meanings.definition: A person who performs menial tasks or runs errands for someone else.
meanings.sent1: The flunkie delivered the mail to the office every morning.
meanings.sent2: The office manager asked the flunkie to make copies of important documents.
meanings.sent3: The flunkie accidentally spilled coffee on the boss's shirt while rushing to get it.
meanings.sent4: The flunkie was like a shadow, always following the CEO around the office.
meanings.sent5: Being a flunkie taught him the value of hard work and dedication.

meanings.definition: To fail a test or course due to poor performance.
meanings.sent1: I hope I don't flunkie the math exam tomorrow.
meanings.sent2: If you don't study, you might flunkie the history test.
meanings.sent3: He managed to flunkie every quiz this semester, much to his surprise.
meanings.sent4: She felt like she was about to flunkie the most important test of her life.
meanings.sent5: The pressure to not flunkie the final exam was overwhelming.
